medical_history.chief_complaint: Slurred speech and somnolence for three days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began three days prior to presentation with slurred speech and somnolence. The patient had significant pain after an orthopedic procedure but was alert and oriented. On the day of admission, she complained of 'black diarrhea' and tactile fevers. Her speech slurred and confusion worsened alongside increasing somnolence after starting Vicodin. She also began to exhibit rapid breathing and chest pain, which led to her being brought to the ED.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1) ESRD since ___ - HD x ___ years s/p cadaveric renal transplant ___ at ___ 2) Stroke ___ - L-sided hemiparesis with some residual, uses a cane at times 3) h/o obesity 4) h/o HTN 5) R shoulder rotator cuff tear - repair ___ 6) Epilepsy since stroke in ___ with last seizure > ___ 7) Depression/Anxiety 8) s/p multiple UTIs since transplant 9) s/p varicose vein stripping on Left 10) post-partum cardiomyopathy 11) small hiatal hernia 12) grade II hemorrhoids 13) h/o colitis ___ 14) s/p CCY ___ 15) L leg abscess ___ s/p I&D 16) LMP - ___ years ago (when started dialysis) 17) LGIB s/p colonoscopy on ___ 18) bursitis in the knees and ankles 19) migraines 20) toxemia of pregnancy ___ 21) gastroesophageal reflux disease.
